sprite.name: Lava Bubble (Podoboo)
sprite.notes: The Lava Bubble (Podoboo) is a firey enemey that will jump up from the lava to the height it is placed at. It can only jump a maximum of 15 blocks above the lava.

dependency.notes: The Podoboo requires [139] Lava within 15 blocks underneath it in order to appear.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Podoboo.

value.title: Delay Between Jumps
value.comment: This determines the delay between each of the Podoboo's jumps.
value.comment2: Each value is approximately 1 game second. Podoboos first load in the air at the top of their jump, so a Podoboo with a large delay value may not even interact with the player as they run by.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (4)
checkbox.comment: An unknown flag for Nybble 11.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (2)
checkbox.comment: An unknown flag for Nybble 11.

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: A normal sized Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Thwomps are not capable of destroying tileset objects unless set to Crush Forever.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
dualbox.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the style of the Thwomp.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: An unknown setting for Nybble 12.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Bit 47-48 may be a list, but only value 2 has been defined. Value 3 is confirmed to CRASH the game, so do not activate this with Crush Forever. However, value 1 may provide different effects. Experimenting and testing are required.

sprite.name: Auto-Rotating 4-Platform
sprite.notes: This platform is similar to the Reznor platforms from Super Mario World. It consists of four 6x1 platforms that rotate around the center point. <font color="green">NewerGEM added several new models to the sprite.</font>

dualbox.comment: This determines which way the platform will rotate.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the model or texture used for the sprite.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Looper (While X, do Y THEN Z+, Repeat)
sprite.notes: Similar to the Multi-Chainer, this controller will activate a sequence of Events ranging from [Target Event ID Start] through [Target Event ID End]. However, it will only activate one event at a time. After activating one event, it will deactivate it and activate the next event. Once it has done this for all events, if the [Triggering Event ID] is still activated, it will return to [Target Event ID Start] and begin again.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event will activate the Event Looper going from the Start ID to the End ID, and back again so long as this event is still active.

value.title: Target Event ID Start
value.comment: When the Triggering Event is activated, this Event ID will be activated first. It will then run until it reaches [Target Event ID End].

value.title: Target Event ID End
value.comment: After enabling and disabling this event, if the Triggering Event is still activated, the Looper will return to [Target Event ID Start] and repeat the loop.

value.title: Delay:
value.comment:
This determines the amount of frames the Looper will wait between activating/deactivating each event.

The code for this has been improved for NewerGEM.

0 = 1 frame
1 = 10 frames
2 = 20 frames
...
6 = 60 frames
...
249 = 2490 frames (42.5 seconds)
250 = 60 seconds
251 = 90 sec
252 = 120 sec
253 = 150 sec
254 = 180 sec
255 = 210 sec

sprite.name: Fire Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots fireballs at the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Fire Bro.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes: Use this to spawn any actor into the game! Anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones.

dependency.notes:
This Actor Spawner requires a linked [88] Actor Spawner in Data Bank Mode to store the settings that will be used by the spawned actor.

Additionally, the actor that will be spawned must be placed as a sprite somewhere else in the level in order for the game to know to load the required assets. When trying to spawn an actor without an equivalent sprite, place a sprite that can create that actor into the level.

dualbox.comment: This option exists for compatibility with the original NewerSMBW levels. Choose the second option to access new and improved settings!

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create one copy of the actor at the location of the spawner. Keep in mind that some sprites have abnormal placement so expect a lot of testing to make sure that everything works correctly.
value.comment2: The Triggering Event ID is limited to only the first 15 Event IDs.

checkbox.title: Automatically Respawn
checkbox.comment: When the actor spawned by this spawner is deleted or missing, and the event is triggered, another actor with the same settings will be spawened. This also stops the spawned actor from despawning when the event is deactivated.

value.title: Actor ID - Number Entry
value.comment: Please enter the extension that you wish to dial. If your party cannot be reached, please dial a different number. Thank you.
value.comment2: Do not use an Actor ID that does not return a value on the list below.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Actor ID.

dualbox.comment: A version of this sprite in Spawner Mode will pull data from another version of this sprite in Data Bank Mode with a matching Search ID. Nybbles 1-12 of the Data Bank will be used by the actor spawned by the Actor Spawner.

value.title: Search ID
value.comment: Match this ID with a corresponding [88] Actor Spawner. The Actor Spawner will pull nybbles 1-12 from the Data Bank for use when spawning an actor.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create the specified actor at its location.

value.title: Actor ID (Numerical Entry)
value.comment: Enter the Actor ID of the actor you wish to spawn here. If you don't know the ID, use the selection box below.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this to find the Actor ID of any actor.

checkbox.title: Multi-Spawn Mode
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will not keep track of the actors it spawns, meaning the event can be toggled on and off to spawn more actors.

checkbox.title: Respawn Automatically
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will automatically respawn the actor if it is deleted or missing.

checkbox.title: Despawn Without Event
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Actor Spawner will despawn the actor it spawned when its event is turned off.

checkbox.title: Save Despawn Position
checkbox.comment: When checked, when the Actor Spawner despawns an actor due to its event being turned off it will move to the position the actor was just in. If the event is turned back on, the new actor will be spawned at that position.

list.title: Spawn Delay
list.comment: When not set to Manual, this option will cause the Actor Spawner to wait the specified number of frames after initially spawning an actor before spawning another one. The event will stay on the whole time.
list.comment2: When set to Manual, this option will cause the Actor Spawner to disable its triggering event after spawning an actor so that it can be manually turned back on.
list.advancedcomment: Using Manual will not work when trying to use two Actor Spawners triggered by the same event, because one will disable the event before the other can execute.

value.title: Nybble 1
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 1 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 2
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 2 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 3
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 3 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 4
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 4 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 5
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 5 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 6
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 6 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 7
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 7 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 8
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 8 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 9
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 9 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 10
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 10 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 11
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 11 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

value.title: Nybble 12
value.comment: Edit the value of nybble 12 in the spawned actor. For easier edits, use the Modify Raw Data box.

sprite.name: Boomerang Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws Boomerangs at the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Boomerang Bro.

sprite.name: Hammer Bro Plus
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws hammers (or other objects!) at the player.

dependency.notes: The Hammer Bro will first calculate where the nearest solid ground is. This is defined as a terrain object with solid block collision. With a platform limit of one, he can jump onto any passthrough terrain or brick blocks above this solid ground at a distance of 4. With a platform limit of two, he can jump between this platform and another one above it. When on the top of this platform limit, he will not try and jump upwards. He can also jump down from passthrough terrain set higher than 8 blocks above the solid ground, though he will not be able to return.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Hammer Bro.

list.title: Thrown Object
list.comment: This determines which object will be thrown by the Hammer Bro Plus.

sprite.name: Pipe Enemy Generator
sprite.notes: Use this to spawn waves of either Goombas or Bob-Ombs from a pipe.

dependency.notes: The spawner must be placed directly on the edge of the pipe in order to function. If spawning Left or Right, place it directly on the bottom square. If spawning Up or Down, place it directly on the left square.

dualbox.comment: This determines which enemy will be spawned from the pipe.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spawned Goombas.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Spawned Bob-Ombs.

list.title: Exit Direction
list.commnet: This determines which direction the enemy will spawn from the pipe.
list.comment2: The spawner must be correctly positioned or it will not function. See Dependency Notes for more information.

list.title: Number of Enemies Spawned
list.comment: This determines how many enemies will be spawned in a row before a delay occurs.

sprite.name: Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: A standard Bob-Omb enemy. It will spawn walking towards the player and will fall off of ledges. When stepped on or struck with a fireball, it will eventually explode damaging certain types of blocks, terrain, and enemies.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation state is used by the Bob-Omb when it is first loaded. Changing this value is not recommended.
list.comment2: Frozen in Ice (Minus Ice): The Bob-Omb is placed at a random angle in a random spot inside a square of 3x3 blocks, the sprite's placement it the middle block. It appears somewhere between Layer 1 and Layer 2, and cannot be interacted with in any way.

list.title: Unknown Value 12
list.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

sprite.name: Broozer
sprite.notes: A ghost house enemy that behaves similarly to Chargin' Chuck from Super Mario World. He must be stepped on twice in order to be defeated. He will also destroy certain types of blocks and terrain with his flailing attack. Please note that he can only destroy tileset bricks and not sprite bricks.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the broozer's model.

sprite.name: Goal Pole and Fortress
sprite.notes: The invisible wall does not extend below the Goal Pole.

checkbox.title: NewerGEM: No Invisible Wall
checkbox.notes: This setting deactivates the invisible wall. Players can jump over the Goal Pole and activate it from the other side.

sprite.name: Crowber Crow
sprite.notes: A purple crow enemy called a Crowber that will fly around in the skies above the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the crow's model.

sprite.name: Message Box
sprite.notes: A block that the player can hit which will display a custom message. Messages are defined in Message.py.

dependency.notes: The Message Box Controller must be included in each Zone for Message Boxes to function correctly.

value.title: NewerGEM: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Select an Event ID that triggers the message.

value.title: Message ID
value.comment: Messages defined in Message.py. Add 256 to the value shown in the Newer Message Editor program.

sprite.name: Fire Snake
sprite.yoshinotes: While Yoshi cannot safely jump on this enemy, if he eats one he will spit out a fireball.
sprite.notes: A hopping fire enemy that will also affect the lighting in a dark Zone.

checkbox.title: Hides and Waits
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Fire Snake will be a stationary ball of fire until the player approaches it.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the fire Snake's model.

sprite.name: Mushroom in a Bubble
sprite.notes: <font color="orange">This sprite is not recommended for use, and it WILL crash the game if used with invalid settings.</font>
sprite.advancednotes: This is capable of spawning both items and players inside of bubbles. Unfortunately it was not designed to be called on for stand-alone functions.

checkbox.title: Spawns Mushroom in a Bubble
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this will spawn a Mushroom floating in a bubble.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the floating bubble will appear.

list.title: Spawns Player in a Bubble
list.advancedcomment: Unfortunately, this doesn't work as cleanly as it needs to in order to be usable. If the right player doesn't exist when this loads, the game will crash. It could potentially respawn a dead player who has zero lives, or with the multiplayer bubbles deactivated, except that there is no way to only load the players you actually need. Thus, this function is completely and totally unreliable unless requiring all 4 players to play a particular level.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the bubble's model.

sprite.name: Flying "?" Block
sprite.notes: A '?' Block with wings that flies around until opened, remaining in place afterwards.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines which color the '?' Block will use.

list.title:
Color (2)
NewerGEM
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the '?' Block will fly in.

checkbox.title: Reverse Direction
checkbox.comment: When enabled, Direction will be reversed.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the '?' Block will contain.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-05 A2. Possibly distance related.

sprite.name: Roulette Block
sprite.notes: A large roulette style block that will award either a Star, a 1-Up, a Mushroom, or a specific power-up item. It should be noted that it makes a moderate amount of noise when it's on screen.

list.title: Power-up
list.comment: This determines which power-up the block can provide.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment:
This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.

Pattern and NoSfx/NoGfx fixed in NewerGEM.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area

sprite.name: ? Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard Question Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn enough for every player! Such a generous block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2: Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown. Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains:
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

list.title: Yoshi Color (Types)
list.comment:
This determines the color the Yoshi will have that spawns from the egg.
Please note that the special behavior requires a shell of the same color in Yoshi's mouth. For example, the blue Yoshi needs to swallow a blue shell in order to fly.
Special behaviors "Stomp" and "Fly" are time-gated.
Yoshi can now drop the shell to the ground by pressing "Down" and "Spit".

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the ?-Block will attempt to follow Lines.
checkbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the ?-Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.
dualbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

sprite.name: Checkered Spring Block
sprite.notes: A block with a spring-like effect that allows the player to jump on it and bounce off of it in order to jump higher.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block.

list.title: Alternate NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block when the Alternate Color Pattern is enabled.

checkbox.title: Alternate Color Pattern
checkbox.comment: When enabled, it will use the alternate color.
checkbox.comment2: Using an Inverted Checkers variant allows you to string together a line of Spring Blocks and have them look nice.

sprite.name: D-Pad Door
sprite.notes: A standard door with a D-Pad symbol on it that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the door's model.

sprite.name: Parachute Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: A parachuting Bob-Omb enemy that will turn into a standard Bob-Omb after it lands.

dependency.notes: The Y-position of the Bob-Omb has no effect. It will always appear directly above the top edge of the screen.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

sprite.name: Parachute Bob-Omb Spawn Area
sprite.notes: Assigns a spawn area where parachuting Bob-Ombs will fall from the sky while a player is inside it.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: The parachuting Bob-Ombs will only spawn while a player is in this location.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

sprite.name: Ice Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots ice balls at the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Ice Bro.

sprite.name: Giant Ice Block
sprite.notes: A large 3x3 ice block that can be broken with an explosion.

list.title: Frozen Inside
list.comment: This determines what type of object is frozen inside the block.
list.comment2: Bob-Omb ice blocks will explode to other nearby ice blocks.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the frozen Spiked Ball.

sprite.name: Wooden and Metal Boxes
sprite.notes: Wooden boxes can be opened if Ground-Pounded, struck from below, etc. and can award the player with an item. Metal boxes can instantly kill the player, cannot be destroyed, and make a POW sound when falling. They also have odd issues when it comes to respawning if they have moved from their original location.

dualbox.comment: This determines the type of box.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Wooden Box.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the box.

list.title: Wooden Box Contains
list.comment: This determines what the Wooden Box contains.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 5 might affect something.

sprite.name: 45° Cannon
sprite.notes: A cannon that will fire ammo in a 45° direction, and can fire either cannonballs or Bob-Ombs.

list.title: Camera Influenced Trajectory
list.comment: This determines if the cannonball will be influenced by the camera's actions, such as when using [399] Airship Rocking.

list.title: Ammo Type
list.comment: This determines what the cannon will fire.

value.title: Bob-Omb Delay
value.comment: This determines how long the cannon will wait between each time it launches a Bob-Omb.
value.comment2: This value is measured in game seconds.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon is upside-down and can be placed against the ceiling.

checkbox.title: Rotating Cannon
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon will rotate in the opposite direction after each time it fires.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the cannon will face.
This determines which direction the cannon will fire first.

sprite.name: Monty Mole
sprite.notes: An energetic mole enemy that will pop out of the terrain after loading on screen and proceed to move quickly after the player. A Monty Hole is left behind after the mole jumps out.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Monty Mole.

checkbox.title: Loose Monty Mole
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Monty Mole will already be out of the wall running around, and does not leave behind a Monty Hole.

sprite.name: Platform Hammer Bro
sprite.notes: 'En_Lift_HammerBros' - Likely allows it to be used on places where he shouldn't jump off.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Hammer Bro.

list.title: Thrown Object
list.comment: This determines which object will be thrown by the Hammer Bro Plus.

sprite.name: Sound/Graphic Effects Spawner
sprite.notes:
Enables event-driven spawning of Sound Effects and Graphic Effects.
Limitations
1) Do not use 1000 or more sounds/effects per area
2) A single Event ID can only trigger one sound/effect per area
3) Only a specific number of sounds/effects can be active at the same time
4) Only two BRSTMs can be active at the same time

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the associated sound or affect will be played.

external.title: Sfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Sound Effect.

external.title: Gfx ID (Full Range/NewerGEM):
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Graphic Effect.<b><font color="blue">

dualbox.comment: This determines if you are spawning a sound effect or a graphical effect. (*) NewerGEM allows to choose from 1004 different Gfx.
dualbox.comment2: The volume of the sound effect is relative to the distance of the placement of the spawner.

list.title: Effect Scale
list.comment: This determines the size of the spawned graphic effect.

value.title: Loop Delay
value.comment: This determines the number of seconds between activations of the sound or graphic effect.
value.comment2: The effect will only activate once if the delay is left at 0.

sprite.name: Giant Koopa Shell Cave
sprite.notes: A decorative large shell that can be used as a cave with the right arrangement of invisible blocks and settings.

dependency.notes: Look in Retail 5-01 A1 for an example of how to use this sprite correctly. You will need to make use of Spotlight Lighting, Layer 0 tiles, and invisible collision blocks in order for it to look correct.

checkbox.title: Remove Grass/Rocks
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this will remove the decoration from the bottom of the Shell Cave.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the shell's model.

sprite.name: Lighting - Fire Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative fire lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the fire lamp's model.

sprite.name: POW Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable POW block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will activate and cause the POW effect, killing many types of enemies, knocking coins loose, and other special effects.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: A recolor for the Pow Block.
list.advancedcomment: More effects can be added for your hack.

sprite.name: Barrel
sprite.notes: A grabbable barrel that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will begin to roll until it hits an enemy or a wall. It can also hurt other players.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: A recolor for the Barrel.
list.advancedcomment: More effects can be added for your hack.

sprite.name: Lighting - Glow Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable glowing block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly. Its effect is severely dimished as anything other than a weapon of destruction if not using Full Darkness lighting.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: A recolor for the Glow Block.
list.advancedcomment: More effects can be added for your hack.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

sprite.name: Propeller Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable propeller block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. It can also boost the player into the air like a Propeller Cap if the player shakes their controller a second time while holding it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

sprite.name: Bowser Boss Door
sprite.notes: A very large green door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the door's model.

sprite.name: Credits Controller
sprite.notes:
Plays the credits in Newer.

NewerGEM: A modification for the Credits Controller. It allows several new functions. Requires Credits Controller Mod tool by Grop.

To activate system text: Needs 'Listen to Event and switch to Scene' used in Credits Editor Mod.

To teleport players: Needs path, entrance, and 'Listen to Event' to function.

list.title: NewerGEM: Jump to new Scene
list.comment: Directly jumps to new scene ID specified below and in \NewerRes\StaffRoll.

value.title: NewerGEM: Scene ID
value.comment: Directly loads a Scene ID from a custom SR_X.bin file. Make sure the file is placed in NewerRes\Staffroll. See 'Credits File ID'.

value.title: NewerGEM: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The game will jump to the Scene ID specified below when this Event ID is triggered. This is an additional method to listen to an event and switch the scene accordingly. The same can be done with the Credits Editor Mod as well.

value.title: NewerGEM: Credits File ID
value.comment: Value 0 loads the default file, NewerStaffRoll.bin. All other values load a new file that needs to be placed into the folder \NewerRes\StaffRoll with the filename SR_X.bin, where X is a number. Value 1 loads SR_1.bin, and so on.

dependency.notes: There are several dependencies involved here. See NewerGEM notes. The Staffroll credits themselves however have an editor available for them.
